faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-Spanish citizens can purchase property in Spain. There are no restrictions for EU citizens or most international buyers. The process requires a Spanish fiscal identification number (NIE), legal representation, and adherence to standard conveyancing procedures. Our team can guide you through all requirements and connect you with qualified legal advisors.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, typical costs include: Transfer Tax (6-10% depending on region), Legal fees (€1,000-€3,000), Notary fees (€500-€1,500), and Property registration costs. In Murcia, Transfer Tax is typically 8%. After purchase, annual property taxes (IBI) average €400-€600 per year. Our team provides detailed cost breakdowns for each property.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Purchasing property in Spain does not require a visa. However, if you plan to reside in Spain for extended periods, you may need appropriate residency documentation. EU citizens have rights to residency, while non-EU citizens may need investment visas depending on their country of origin and intended stay duration. Legal advisors can explain residency options relevant to your situation.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spain has two main property taxes: Annual IBI (property tax) averages €400-€600 yearly for properties like CASA ALTARIS, calculated on cadastral value. One-time Transfer Tax (Impuesto de Transmisiones Patrimoniales) typically ranges 6-10% in most regions, with Murcia at approximately 8%. Non-resident owners may have additional wealth tax obligations. Detailed tax estimates are provided upon inquiry.
